intro: Streptopetalum, commonly known as the "spider orchid," is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are characterized by their unique, often intricate flower structures, with petals that resemble spider legs, giving them their common name. Streptopetalum species are native to various regions in Australia and are known for their striking, colorful blooms. They typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and thrive in full sun to partial shade. The genus includes several species, each with distinct floral characteristics and ecological adaptations.
